name: Flight of the Icarus
description: Flight of the Icarus is a game where you play as a privateer who owns an airship that helps ferry goods from town to town in a post-apocalyptic world where the skies are dominated by pirates and danger. Shoot down enemy aeroplanes with a variety of deadly weaponry. Keep the ship from falling out the sky.

reviews.review_text: Multiplayer co-op removed. No point in getting it.

If you can get this game to run, it's quite a fascinating and dark experience with the right amount of tense repairing and blowing things out of the sky. For the sale price, I definitely reccomend this game.
You will not enjoy this game, if you want the good version get the online one.
I found this game to be quite challanging. its a Short game, and it does seem a little unfinished but I enjoyed it. Its also Steampunk, Need i say more?
Controls stopped working on the second level. Tried unistall/reinstall, nothing.  The first level was nice though, running from gun to gun to take down the planes.

I personally do not recommend this game, i do have many friends but none have this game, therefore it is quite boring and the graphics are not great, however i do reccommend guns of icarus online as it is a fantastic online game that never gets boring and you dont need friends to have the game to have fun as there is a whole bunch of people, i greatly recommend you dont get this game and just go straight for the online one.

Piloting, gunning and repairing all work really well and are fun, and with the right team it can get even more fun, but bad or mainly uncooperative teammates can change that. With an uncooperative teammate on your team, it can ruin the game, because it depends so much on teamwork. if one person refuses to do their job, you're going to lose. But with the right teammates, you can have lots of fun evading and outgunning the enemy.

Started out fun. You run around the ship shooting and repairing. They say it works for the MAC, but the second mission I was unable to fire a gun or repair anything. Buggy.
Worth the 50c I paid for it.

You run around using turrets on your floating ship, shooting down incoming planes. When you get damaged, you have to go and repair (click) on section(s) of your ship. When the level finished (it has travelled a certain distance) you get an option to upgrade a weapon and switch the turrets on your ship. You then choose what route to follow for the next 'mission', almost like in Outrun.  It's an interesting game for an hour or two, but it is not going to stay on your hard drive for long.

There's only a few levels (maybe 15), and no level has any variance. Which gives it poor replayability.   However, I really enjoyed this game. My brother even laughed at me because he said it looked really dumb. But I enjoy the process of predicting where the enemies will move and then firing with teh delay of an artillery cannon.  The game is very simple, but it's fun. You'll know within 5 minutes whether you like the game or not.
